title: Art History - Nineteenth Century Art
description: History of painting and sculpture from the French Revolution to the beginning of the 20th century. Focuses on significant movements such as Neo-Classicism, Romanticism, Realism, Impressionism and Post-Impressionism. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE C4 except for Art and Design majors.
prerequisites: Junior standing; completion of GE Area A and ART 111 or ART 112 or ART 211 or ART 212
